verses.kjv: For this cause I Paul, the prisoner of Jesus Christ for you Gentiles,
verses.ct: This is why I, Paul, am a prisoner for the sake of Christ Jesus — specifically for the benefit of you non-Jewish believers.

verses.kjv: If ye have heard of the dispensation of the grace of God which is given me to you-ward:
verses.ct: Surely you've heard about the responsibility God gave me through his grace to serve you.

verses.kjv: How that by revelation he made known unto me the mystery; (as I wrote afore in few words,
verses.ct: God revealed his mystery to me directly, as I briefly described earlier in this letter.

verses.kjv: Whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledge in the mystery of Christ)
verses.ct: When you read what I wrote, you'll be able to grasp the insight I have into the mystery of Christ.

verses.kjv: Which in other ages was not made known unto the sons of men, as it is now revealed unto his holy apostles and prophets by the Spirit;
verses.ct: In previous generations, this wasn't disclosed to humanity the way it has now been revealed to God's holy apostles and prophets through the Spirit.

verses.kjv: That the Gentiles should be fellowheirs, and of the same body, and partakers of his promise in Christ by the gospel:
verses.ct: Here is the mystery: through the gospel, non-Jewish believers are equal heirs with Jewish believers, members of the same body, and equal partners in God's promise through Christ.

verses.kjv: Whereof I was made a minister, according to the gift of the grace of God given unto me by the effectual working of his power.
verses.ct: I became a servant of this gospel through the gift of God's grace, given to me by the working of his power.

verses.kjv: Unto me, who am less than the least of all saints, is this grace given, that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ;
verses.ct: Even though I am the most insignificant of all God's people, this grace was given to me — to proclaim to the non-Jewish world the immeasurable riches of Christ,

verses.kjv: And to make all men see what is the fellowship of the mystery, which from the beginning of the world hath been hid in God, who created all things by Jesus Christ:
verses.ct: and to help everyone understand the outworking of this mystery that has been hidden in God since the beginning of the world — the God who created all things through Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: To the intent that now unto the principalities and powers in heavenly places might be known by the church the manifold wisdom of God,
verses.ct: God's purpose was that now, through the church, his endlessly diverse wisdom would be made known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly realms.

verses.kjv: According to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord:
verses.ct: This was in line with the eternal plan that he carried out through Christ Jesus our Lord.

verses.kjv: In whom we have boldness and access with confidence by the faith of him.
verses.ct: Through him, and through faith in him, we can approach God with boldness and confidence.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I desire that ye faint not at my tribulations for you, which is your glory.
verses.ct: So I ask you not to lose heart because of the suffering I'm going through for your sake — it's actually something that brings you honor.

verses.kjv: For this cause I bow my knees unto the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,
verses.ct: For this reason, I kneel in prayer before the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

verses.kjv: Of whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named,
verses.ct: from whom every family in heaven and on earth receives its name.

verses.kjv: That he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with might by his Spirit in the inner man;
verses.ct: I pray that out of his glorious riches, he would strengthen you with power through his Spirit deep within you,

verses.kjv: That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that ye, being rooted and grounded in love,
verses.ct: so that Christ would make his home in your hearts through faith. I pray that you, being firmly rooted and established in love,

verses.kjv: May be able to comprehend with all saints what is the breadth, and length, and depth, and height;
verses.ct: would have the ability — along with all of God's people — to grasp how wide, how long, how deep, and how high it is,

verses.kjv: And to know the love of Christ, which passeth knowledge, that ye might be filled with all the fulness of God.
verses.ct: and to personally experience the love of Christ, which goes beyond anything we can fully understand, so that you would be filled with the complete fullness of God.

verses.kjv: Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,
verses.ct: Now to the one who is able to do an infinitely greater amount than anything we could ever ask or imagine, through the power that is actively at work within us —

verses.kjv: Unto him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages, world without end. Amen.
verses.ct: to him be glory in the church and in Christ Jesus through every generation, forever and ever. Amen.
